doc.previous: The velocity is small, so the right-moving light is blueshifted by an amount equal to the nonrelativistic Doppler shift factor 1 â v/c. The momentum of the light is its energy divided by c, and it is increased by a factor of v/c. So the right-moving light is carrying an extra momentum ÎP given by:
doc.after: The left-moving light carries a little less momentum, by the same amount ÎP. So the total right-momentum in the light is twice ÎP. This is the right-momentum that the object lost.
